instructions:
Melt half the butter and brush the fish fillets on both sides. Sprinkle with salt and pepper, roll up the
fillets and place the rolls seam side down in a shallow baking dish. Pour 1/4 cup of milk over the fish and
place in a 350 F oven and bake for 25 minutes or until fish flakes. In the meantime, in a saucepan melt the
remaining margarine and stir in the flour and cook for a minute or two. Stir in remaining milk and cook till
the sauce thickens. Then stir in the cheese, mustard and sherry and set aside.
Remove fish from oven and spoon off liquid from fish and save. Add sufficient fish liquid to cheese sauce
to make a consistency of thin batter. Use additional milk if necessary. Pour over fish rolls and place under
broiler until cheese sauce turns a golden brown.
name: Sole Thermidor
